item.title: Regarding SMS 2FA
item.description: Tavis Ormandy, a security researcher I really respect, recently published a blog post stating his opinions on SMS 2FA. I highly encourage you to read his post first so that you’ll have the necessary context. For brevity, I’ll assume you’re aware what 2FA is and how SMS 2FA works. In general, I believe I can summarize Tavis’ argument as follows: SMS 2FA can by bypassed by advanced phishing attacks Even if SMS 2FA raises the bar, the effort spent implementing SMS 2FA can be spent on other things I think an important question that Tavis either explicitly or accidentally omitted is “for whom”.
